questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using the ROC curve?

options.A: To visualize the distribution of data
options.B: To evaluate the performance of a classification model
options.C: To improve the performance of a regression model
options.D: To reduce the dimensionality of the data

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is best for a large-scale classification problem?

options.A: Decision Trees

questions.question: What is a common use case for logistic regression?

options.A: Predicting a continuous variable

questions.question: Which of the following is not a common technique for model evaluation?

options.A: Cross-validation

questions.question: In which scenario is it appropriate to use a support vector machine (SVM)?

options.A: When the dataset has a large number of features and a small number of samples
options.B: When the data is linearly separable

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a validation set in machine learning?

options.A: To train the model
options.B: To test the model's performance on unseen data

questions.question: In hierarchical clustering, how are clusters merged together?

options.A: Based on the closest data points
options.C: Based on a pre-defined number of clusters
options.D: Based on the farthest data points

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using a decision tree for classification tasks?

options.A: It can model complex relationships between features.
options.C: It does not require feature selection.

questions.question: Which machine learning algorithm is used for finding associations and patterns in transactional data?

options.A: Support Vector Machine (SVM)

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 'bagging' technique in ensemble learning?

options.A: Reducing overfitting by training multiple models on the same data
options.B: Combining the predictions of multiple models through voting

questions.question: Which clustering algorithm is sensitive to the initial placement of cluster centroids and can converge to local optima?

options.A: DBSCAN

questions.question: In Bayesian networks, what is a conditional probability distribution represented by?

options.A: A probability table

questions.question: What does the term 'overfitting' refer to in machine learning?

options.A: The model performs well on the training data but poorly on unseen data.
options.B: The model performs consistently on both training and testing data.
options.C: The model is too simple to capture complex patterns in the data.
options.D: The model is underfitting the data.

questions.question: Which regularization technique adds a penalty term to the loss function to discourage large weight values in a neural network?

options.A: L1 regularization

questions.question: In k-nearest neighbors (KNN) classification, how is the class of a data point determined?

options.A: By averaging the classes of its k nearest neighbors
options.B: By selecting the class of the nearest data point
options.C: By comparing its features to a threshold

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) method in Bayesian learning?

options.A: To compute the exact posterior distribution

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the term frequency-inverse document frequency (TF-IDF) representation in text analysis?

options.A: To convert text data into numerical format
options.B: To remove stop words from text data
options.C: To calculate word frequencies in a document

questions.question: In a confusion matrix, which element represents the number of true negative predictions?

options.A: Top-left element

questions.question: What is the primary goal of dimensionality reduction techniques like Principal Component Analysis (PCA)?

options.A: To increase the number of features in the dataset
options.C: To reduce the number of features while preserving important information
options.D: To create new features from existing ones

questions.question: In reinforcement learning, what is the reward signal used for?

options.A: To determine the optimal policy
options.D: To assign labels to training data
